$drop (service in module ui.drop )

Description

Service responsible for controlling the behaviour of droppable nodes. $drop provides a mechanism to drop-enable any arbitrary element, which allows it to be used in custom directives, so that custom dragging behaviour can be achieved.

Dependencies

  • $document
  • $rootScope

Methods

  • drop(event, y)

    Given a client position at which a mouse was released, or a mouse release is being simulated, this method attempts to find the nearest Droppable element, onto which the dragged element shall be dropped.

    The css display of the dragged element is set to 'none' so that document.elementFromPoint() will not always return the dragged element.

    If implementing custom drag/drop functionality, it is important to ensure that the non-hidden css display be restored when finished.

    Parameters

    • event – {Event|number} –

      Either a DOM Event object which contains client coordinates of a mouse release, or else the x coordinate at which the mouse was released.

    • y(optional) – {number=} –

      The second parameter may serve as the y coordinate at which the mouse was released, and is expected to be if event is a number.

  • dropAllowed(The, An)

    Function to check if the provided draggable element has the class of the provided droppables 'allowed' attribute. Returns true if a match is found, or false otherwise.

    Parameters

    • The – {droppable} –

      ui.drop.$drop.Droppable object

    • An – {draggable} –

      angular.element() object representing the draggable

    Returns

    {boolean} –

    whether or not the drop is allowed based

  • droppable(element, options)

    Queries for the Droppable state of a DOM node. If the element is not Droppable, and options !== false, then a new Droppable object is instantiated and associated with the element.

    As such, this method can be used to query for the existence of Droppable state attached to a DOM node, similar to isDroppable().

    TODO: Control actual behaviour of Droppable state with passed in options.

    Parameters

    • element – {element} –

      jQuery / jqLite element or DOM node to be checked for Droppable state, or to be the element to which a new Droppable state is associated.

    • options – {object|boolean} –

      Configuration options for the Droppable state to be created. If set to false, no Droppable state will be created, and the function instead acts as a simple query.

    Returns

    {Object} –

    The Droppable state bound to the element.

  • isDroppable()

    Query the droppable status of an element. Droppable in this context means that the element has Droppable state attached to it, and does not currently include other factors which might enable or disable the dropping a node into an element.

    Returns

    {boolean} –

    The draggable status of an element (true if an element is drag-enabled, otherwise false)

Properties

  • version

    A reference to the global ui.drop.Version object.

    Returns

    {ui.drop.Version} –

    Version
